intro: Cyclostegia strobilifera, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils, often in alpine or subalpine environments. Its unique floral structure features a tubular corolla with five lobes, and it produces small, leathery fruits that contain numerous seeds. Cyclostegia strobilifera is adapted to cold climates and is often found in association with other high-altitude flora.
